meanings.definition: Persistently recurring in the mind; unforgettable.
meanings.sent1: The haunting melody stayed with me all day.
meanings.sent2: The old house had a haunting atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The haunting dream made me chuckle when I woke up.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories clung to her like a shadow.
meanings.sent5: The haunting image of the abandoned playground was etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: To visit or inhabit as a ghost.
meanings.sent1: The ghost haunting the castle scared the visitors.
meanings.sent2: The spirits were said to be haunting the graveyard at night.
meanings.sent3: The friendly ghost haunting the attic liked to play pranks.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past seemed to hauntingly linger in the old mansion.
meanings.sent5: The ghost haunting the old well was rumored to be seeking revenge.

meanings.definition: To be continually present in the thoughts or memories of someone.
meanings.sent1: The loss of her pet haunting her thoughts made her sad.
meanings.sent2: The memories of their time together continued to haunt him.
meanings.sent3: The idea of going to the dentist was haunting her mind all day.
meanings.sent4: The haunting feeling of regret lingered in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The haunting words of the fortune teller echoed in her mind.
